skill.name: metabolomics-workbench-database
skill.description: Access NIH Metabolomics Workbench via REST API (4,200+ studies). Query metabolites, RefMet nomenclature, MS/NMR data, m/z searches, study metadata, for metabolomics and biomarker discovery.
skill.summary: Access NIH Metabolomics Workbench via REST API (4,200+ studies). Query metabolites, RefMet nomenclat...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: Only documentation and example API calls are present. No credential access, environment harvesting, or executable payloads are included. Network examples target the official Metabolomics Workbench domain.

content.value_statement: You need reliable metabolomics study and compound data with consistent nomenclature. This skill guides precise REST queries for studies, RefMet, and mass searches.
actual_capabilities: Query compound data by IDs like PubChem, KEGG, and HMDB
Retrieve study summaries, factors, and experimental data
Standardize names using RefMet match and classification
Run m/z searches with adduct and tolerance settings
Look up gene and protein records by symbols or IDs
limitations: Does not analyze or interpret biological results
Cannot access private or restricted studies without API support
Depends on Metabolomics Workbench API availability
Large queries may need batching and caching by the user

use_cases.title: Find disease studies
use_cases.description: Locate studies for a disease and sample type using MetStat filters and study summaries.

use_cases.title: Standardize metabolites
use_cases.description: Map common metabolite names to RefMet and retrieve classifications for consistent datasets.

use_cases.title: Identify candidates
use_cases.description: Run m/z searches with adducts and tolerances to shortlist candidate compounds.

prompt_templates.title: List study summaries
prompt_templates.prompt: List available public studies and show how to get a summary for ST000001 in JSON.

prompt_templates.title: RefMet name match
prompt_templates.prompt: Find the RefMet standardized name for citrate and show the request URL.

prompt_templates.title: m/z candidate search
prompt_templates.prompt: Search MB for m/z 180.06 with M+H and 0.5 tolerance, then show how to fetch compound details.

prompt_templates.title: MetStat filtered query
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a MetStat query for human blood diabetes studies with LCMS positive HILIC.

output_examples.input: Find studies that include tyrosine and show the first study summary request.
output: Use RefMet or direct refmet_name search with Tyrosine

best_practices: Standardize metabolite names with RefMet before study searches
Set adduct and tolerance to match instrument mode
Cache large reference datasets to reduce repeated calls
anti_patterns: Using unstandardized names in study searches
Running broad MetStat queries without filters
Ignoring output formats and parsing assumptions

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, it provides REST guidance that works in Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What limits should I expect?
faq.answer: There are no strict published limits, but large queries should be batched and cached.

faq.question: Can I integrate this into my pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes, use the documented REST endpoints from scripts or workflow tools.

faq.question: Does this skill access my private data?
faq.answer: No, it only documents public API endpoints and does not access local files.

faq.question: What should I do if a request fails?
faq.answer: Check the endpoint path, input value encoding, and API status codes.

faq.question: How does this compare to a local database?
faq.answer: It offers authoritative public data without local storage or maintenance overhead.
